STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 13, 2021
Kara Mularz
Ogemaw/Roscommon County DHHS
444 E Houghton
West Branch, MI 48661
RE: License #: CP650201338
Ogemaw/Roscommon County DHHS
444 E Houghton
West Branch, MI 48661
Dear Mrs. Mularz:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/08/2021. You have submitted an acceptable written corrective action plan covering
the violations cited in the report. It should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes
and rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. Your certificate of approval
license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

Licensee Name: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services

Lansing, MI 48902

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12306 Application request.
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has been
given an application for renewal of the license not less than
60 calendar days before the expiration date of the license.
One of the six current foster home files reviewed indicated the licensee did not
receive an application for renewal of the license at least 60 calendar days before the
expiration date of the license. The licensee was given the application 02/23/2021 for
the renewal of a license with an expiration date of 04/04/2021.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the
reevaluation. The placement specifications shall include all
of the following:
(d) Number of children preferred by the family,
(e) Characteristics of children best served by the home,
Two of the six current foster home files reviewed contained an annual evaluation
report that did not appropriately document the number of children recommended for
placement (d), or the characteristics of children recommended for placement (e).
The included a report dated 12/22/2020 that recommended a capacity of 2 and the
subsequent license (3706) indicated a capacity of 3. The second contained an
annual evaluation dated 09/03/20 that only contained a statement “unrelated care”
and did not include the characteristics as required by this rule.
2

R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make
a licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
Three of the six current foster home files reviewed contained documentation that
indicated the reevaluation and recommendation for the renewal of the license was
not completed/submitted at least 15 calendar days before the expiration of the
license. In the first the expiration date of the license was 04/04/2021 and the
reevaluation was dated 04/01/2021. In the second the expiration date of the license
was 12/12/2020 and the reevaluation report was signed 12/22/2020. In the third the
expiration date of the license was 06/29/2021 and the reevaluation report was
signed 07/15/2021.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services
worker that has children placed in the home.
Four of the four special evaluations reviewed did not include documentation the
social services worker with children placed in the home was given a copy the special
evaluation report upon its completion.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(1) An agency shall develop service plans with the child,
the child's parents or legal guardian, the referring agency,
and the other parties involved in providing needed
services, or medical care, unless the agency documents
why any of the entities have not been involved.
One of the three current foster child records reviewed did not include adequate
documentation that the service plans were developed with all the parties identified
by this rule or documentation why any of the entities were not involved.
Documentation to indicate this involvement would include signed Parent/Agency
Treatment Plans (PATP), which was not signed by the required parties for two report
periods.
3

R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of the three current foster child records reviewed contained an updated service
plan that was completed outside the time frame required by this rule. In this
example the updated service plan with a time period ending 11/14/2020 was not
completed until 01/08/2021. This is a repeat violation established from the
annual evaluation completed 09/17/2020 with the CAP approved 10/20/2020.
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the youth
and the social service worker. The contract shall be
reviewed and updated at least once every 90 calendar days
and a copy provided to the youth.
One of the three current independent living files reviewed did not include an
independent living agreement(s) as required by this rule. In this file the youth had an
identified date of placement of 10/01/2020 and the one agreement that was located
was completed 08/13/2021. This is a repeat violation established from the
annual evaluation completed 09/17/2020 with the CAP approved 10/20/2020.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
4

FOM 722-06B FAMILY TEAM MEETING
FTMs must occur within the required time frames as outlined in
the following tables:
Case Plan Reassessment (USP): Within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date.
One of the three current foster child records reviewed did not include an FTM for one
report period.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
• All signed documents should include dates of signature
• Contact with caregivers shall be documented clearly in the case contacts at
the required intervals
V. CONSULTATION
Consultation was not requested or required during this review.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period for the interim evaluation completed
09/17/2020 that was approved 10/20/2020. Areas identified in noncompliance as a
part of the interim evaluation were R 400.12327(1)(c), (5)(a)(b), R 400.12326(1)(f), R
400.12404(6)(a), R 400.12405(3)(g), (4), R 400.12417(1)(b)(i)(j), R
400.12418(2)(a)(b), R 400.12509(3)(g), and R 400.12510(2). The only areas
identified as repeat noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation were R
400.12418(2)(b) and R 400.12510(2).
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment dated 08/24/2021 reviewed areas of
noncompliance from the previous annual evaluation, impact of staffing changes,
impact of COVID restrictions, and the additional use of technology resources to
address ongoing case management responsibilities and supervision.
Interviews
Eight foster care services related staff participated in entrance and exit interviews
with no areas of concern noted.
5

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The DCWL Analyst identified one safety concern as follows:
Safety Alert: In a relative home there was an operable washer and dryer in the
sleeping room of the foster child.
Resolution: A safety plan was developed in which the washer/dryer would not be
used while the room was occupied by the foster child and the appliance’s child
safety locks would be used. Photos confirmed the appliances have child safety
locks. A variance was also approved as a part of this relative home’s subsequent
licensure.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. An
acceptable corrective action plan has been received/approved; it is recommended
that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
09/13/2021
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 14, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
